summary: The document is a declassified record associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It highlights the discovery of archives that shed light on CIA activities, with a particular focus on Indonesia. The record details interactions among Philip Agee, Stephen M. Weissman, and Dewi Sukarno, and references correspondence between William L. Oltmans and Dewi Sukarno concerning Senate investigations into CIA operations in Indonesia. It also raises inquiries about the acquisition by Philip Agee of letters intended for Senator Frank Church.
key_findings: The document is linked to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
Archives revealing CIA activities, especially in Indonesia, were discovered.
Interactions involving Philip Agee, Stephen M. Weissman, and Dewi Sukarno are documented.
Letters between William L. Oltmans and Dewi Sukarno about Senate investigations and CIA activities in Indonesia are mentioned.
Questions are raised regarding how Philip Agee obtained copies of letters addressed to Senator Frank Church.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
